title: Can we just have Kench do what he's supposed to do?
body:
I don't care if he does damage. I'm not supposed to be doing damage. That's the job of my carry.

What I'm supposed to do is:

* tank for my team
* save a teammate from a fight if they get too low
* lock down enemies with my stacks and my Q

Nerfing all of that, and going even further to buff his damage is spitting in the face of his original design. Before Taric was reworked, I used to play him as my one tank support. They introduced a new stun mechanic that I'm not a fan of, and also turned him in to more of an enchanter, which made playing him pointless as I'd rather play Nami if I wanted to be an enchanter. I gravitated towards Kench because I really liked his character based off of his lore, and wanted to foster that in to making him my replacement tank support. All of these changes that he's going to be getting just push him away from that role in my eyes, towards top or jungle instead. I know Alistar, Braum and Leona exist, but I don't want to play them. I like Kench's unique ability to directly save someone from bad decisions. If the cooldown is increased by that much, why would I bother doing that when I'd just play him top and focus on damage instead? I don't want to do that. There's plenty of tanks played top already.

Nerf his damage. I shouldn't be the one killing everything anyways. Let me tank for my teammates and save them.

Yep. Riot seems to want EVERY champ to be flashy and do tons of damage. This of course, has ramifications that make the game even more unfun. Garen is probably the biggest example of this. If anything, this Kench change is worrying because of the effects that it could have on other supports, with the increase of damage to everyone. It's not a good design choice.

And that's a bad thing why, exactly?

I think in general, the fact that tanks can put out stupid amounts of damage is dumb. If you're a tank, you're basically a support in your own right. That's how it is in pretty much every game as it stands. You sacrifice your own ability to be able to kill things, so that your damage dealers can better do that. Sure, tanks CAN do damage. In WoW, which I realize isn't exactly a 1:1 comparison to a moba, but there, tanks can do damage. They just don't do a lot though, certainly not enough to get the job done themselves. As a tank, your job is to frontline for your team and deny the enemy DPS access to your DPS. That's accomplished through you being tanky, causing their DPS to focus you, and utilizing CC to slow their advances on your DPS if all else fails.

Kench should be tanky. I'm fine with his E being strong in that regard. He has CC in the form of applying stacks to enemy DPS and slowing/stunning them so that they can't reach your DPS, and if worst comes to worst, he can eat his own DPS to take them out of the battle if they get too low. Whether that mechanic in its own right is toxic or not is another debate, but it's one that clearly marks him as being able to fulfill both his supportive role, and his tank role. Nowhere in the equation should his damage be any large factor in to how he works. And really, I think that should go for all tanks. If you bring a tank toplane, you should accept the fact that you sacrifice agency in lane against something like a bruiser or a marksman so that you'll have a better frontline when it comes to teamfights. How would you beat a bruiser in lane, then? Get your jungler to realise that your matchup isn't good, and have them react accordingly to that information, whether they choose to help your lane out, or get another lane fed so that even more progress can be made in a lane where the matchup is better.

Kench is a tank. He should not be a dominant force toplane. You're more than welcome to do that, but there should be counterplay afforded to classes that are designed to shut your class down.
